website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for high-quality pressureless tennis balls, this is a good choice – 18 balls by Wilson that are built for casual play or honing your skills.
pros: Made for novice players or practice sessions
Pressureless balls offer more subdued performance and reliable durability for mastering and improving the game
Works well in automatic ball machines
cons: Not for serious players or competition-level play
Somewhat lighter than other standard balls, and the seams are visible

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Penn version instead
customer_reviews.text: Buy the Penn version. I bought both and the Wilson is just a much worse quality. Felt/cover is rough like sandpaper, and can clearly see how the two halves are joined. Overall play doesn’t feel like a real tennis ball
customer_reviews.author: Ray H.

customer_reviews.title: Uneven and crack easily. Not suitable for tennis
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible for playing tennis. I got them for practicing serves. Some of them cracked after just a few hits. Many others deform. They aren’t glued together evenly so many of them bounce off the ground randomly. Poor quality. Any recommendations on pressureless balls one could actually play tennis with?
customer_reviews.author: Valeria Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: tennis balls
customer_reviews.text: These work much better than regular balls when playing below 50 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick D.

customer_reviews.title: Great dog toys that last!
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs that enjoy their tennis balls. These are the only ones that seem to hold up. When the first arrive they do smell like a tire, so I wash them in the machine with some unscented plant based detergent. I’ve been buying these for years.
customer_reviews.author: SavvyShopper88

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bounce at low temperatures
customer_reviews.text: These balls are simply excellent for outdoor tennis in winter - for the few of us who do play outdoors in winter! Pressurized tennis balls lose their bounce at low temperatures, these do not. At higher temperatures the bounce seems too large.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: nice bounce
customer_reviews.text: I got the cheap tennis balls last time - not any more. These are great - they bounce much better and they aren't as easy for my dog to destroy.
customer_reviews.author: MadameP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, long lasting bounce
customer_reviews.text: These tennis balls seem to last forever even when the yellow disappears. The bounce and "pop" is excellent. I wanted to see how long they would perform well so i wrote the date on 3 of them and so far they have lasted 1 month of playing 3 times a week for 2 hour sessions. My only complaint is that seem not regularly available for 2 day Amazon Prime shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Bali Dude

customer_reviews.title: After Multiple Uses...
customer_reviews.text: I've played six times with the entire bag of balls, and some very hard hitting, and they are still performing well. The only thing I don't like is that they lose their felt pretty quickly. They don't lose all of their felt, but certainly not like a new, popped set of three traditional. Just keep that in mind as you use these over time.
customer_reviews.author: Mikem

customer_reviews.title: Good for tennis practice
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3.5 USTA rating. These are good practice balls. I keep both regular Wilson and these pressureless balls in my practice caddy. If I don’t look I can’t tell the difference most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good for Super Chewer Dogs
customer_reviews.text: I buy these regularly for my dog. She can normally destroy a tennis ball in about 6 seconds flat but she takes a lot longer with these and enjoys just crunching them in her mouth since they squish instead of breaking. They also fit perfectly into her large iDog tennis ball launcher.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: We just play as a family - so no pro tips here. We had some older tennis balls and you could really tell the difference when we upgraded to these.
customer_reviews.author: M. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Thick seam line
customer_reviews.text: All balls have thick seam line running across them that will bounce weird when it hits the ground
customer_reviews.author: Thai Quoc Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Fast ship, great product for my dog!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a bag of balls for my dog
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Fetch!!
customer_reviews.text: I really can't speak for the durability or longevity. My daughter's dog is gonna love his Xmas present.
customer_reviews.author: DMTCR

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em; Dogs love 'em
customer_reviews.text: We have a few acres for the dogs to run, so I imagine we have over 100 tennis balls hidden here and there in the little woods and field. This is an economic, good quality ball with lots of bounce.
customer_reviews.author: Farm Girl

customer_reviews.title: Dog’s dream come true
customer_reviews.text: Great fun for my little dog who pushes them under the couch over and over again when we try to play catch.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Garnett

customer_reviews.title: Serves their purpose for practice
customer_reviews.text: I like these bulk bags for practice and drills. You don’t need to spend a lot to practice drills and such. They’ll take a beating too.
customer_reviews.author: The Dude13

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog park.  Comes with bag
customer_reviews.text: Dog loved it. 18 balls. She ran her little legs off
customer_reviews.author: Jess ak

customer_reviews.title: Best tennis ball for dogs.  Much better than any 'dog toy' brand.
customer_reviews.text: Best tennis ball for dogs. Much better than any 'dog toy' brand.
customer_reviews.author: Hoggie

customer_reviews.title: Believe it or not
customer_reviews.text: We use these at my hotel in the dryer. They are great at collecting hair! :)
customer_reviews.author: Foxy

customer_reviews.title: Tennis balls
customer_reviews.text: They're fuzzy. They bounce. My dog like them. They do their job.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Glass

customer_reviews.title: The best!!
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with tennis balls. They are for a lab and last forever. Sturdy tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good practice ball
customer_reviews.text: Great for doing drills with the kids. Wouldn't recommend for regular play but that's now what we purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick van der Hart

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased.
customer_reviews.text: It’s been so convenient to have this bag of balls
customer_reviews.author: Daren Wallace

customer_reviews.title: It has a ledge in the middle
customer_reviews.text: The balls have a ledge in the middle of every single ball. I never seen this before. Not good :(
customer_reviews.author: Aline Sousa Decker

customer_reviews.title: nothing to good, but it does let you play and have ...
customer_reviews.text: This balls are average, nothing to good, but it does let you play and have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Dog Owners must buy.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t play tennis but my dogs sure do love these things. I bought this bag in 2016 and finally have to re-order. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: Normal Size
customer_reviews.text: Unlike some other bulk tennis balls, these are normal size and fit the chuckit launcher.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Very durable, great for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves these! She was chewing though normal tennis balls every couple of days but I haven't seen her even come close to opening these up.
customer_reviews.author: Cale

customer_reviews.title: perfect buy
customer_reviews.text: great balls , i think they are good deal too
customer_reviews.author: Nelson R Outa

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product but a bit pricey - cheaper at Big5.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I’m sending back. They look like old. Doesn’t jump well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our family Schnauzer loves them and hasn't been able to pop open the first one after 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased as a gift toy for our standard Schnauzer family dog, which with very strong jaws has a tendency to pop open many other tennis balls (its favorites), but so far the first one we gave it is still good. It hasn't been able to pop it open.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Garcia CCS-400097

customer_reviews.title: Make for great and inexpensive dog balls!
customer_reviews.text: These pressureless tennis balls last a lot longer with my ball obsessed Labrador, and the bag of balls was both a good deal per ball and much more convenient and eco friendly than tennis balls purchased in cans.
customer_reviews.author: gingerpie

customer_reviews.title: Top-notch
customer_reviews.text: So much better than "Tourna" brand. These have nice tight nap that lasts much longer. The tight nap throws better too. Use them for the dog. The molding-seam is clearly visible, so they probably aren't good for tennis?
customer_reviews.author: Noyb

customer_reviews.title: They work just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I don't play tennis I use these tennis balls for the back legs on my walker. They prevent the walker from moving when I put pressure on the arms of the walker. They work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ok for just playing with the dogs or kid practice...
customer_reviews.author: steven cochrane

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality balls
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality balls: you can see the joint. They are lighter than normal balls.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent H.

customer_reviews.title: They are good for my dog
customer_reviews.text: They are good for my dog, she is a ball fiend. They pop faster than the other, more expensive tennis balls but get the job done. I didn't notice the bad smells like the other reviews, seemed fine to me. Overall, good value.
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted-a big bunch of tennis balls for my kids to play with (not serious tennis use). The bag is sturdy for storage, too.
customer_reviews.author: Zelda G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My Jack Russell love these tennis balls. Can't go anywhere without them!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A.

customer_reviews.title: Wilson Tennis balls
customer_reviews.text: Good balls, they are used for basketball drills. Arrived on time and are as described. Would buy again. Mesh bag has ripped but that's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Wilson Tennis Balls are the best, NO question about it!
customer_reviews.text: Wilson Tennis Balls are the best, NO question about it! They finally did get here, took longer then they said, but the dogs love them!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Blue Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My Lab enjoys these! Of course one at a time. 😆
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great tennis balls for my dog
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves them and hasn't destroyed any yet. Though the bag was sliced open when I received it, a little disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Heather C

customer_reviews.title: Great for the dogs
customer_reviews.text: Great for the dogs. I don't play tennis so I bought these for them. They seem to love them. ***As with all tennis balls...they are not lawn mower friendly. Trust me. ***
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Parker

customer_reviews.title: Dog likes her balls.
customer_reviews.text: Balls came in the sack. I opened them all at once to watch my dog's enjoyment because they are her balls. She doesnt rip these apart or pull the fuzz from them like other tennis balls. Balls are good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lovr them! Great for my GSD
customer_reviews.text: Got them for my German Shepherd as he was tearing up pet store and other brands in a few days. These are just great. Very durable, and also nice to get 18 when your stinker likes to hide tennis balls all over the yard and house. Good price!
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected but...
customer_reviews.text: Works like regular tennis balls but a little expensive than most.
customer_reviews.author: dtd3cebu

product_meta.title: Wilson Wilson Pressureless Tennis Balls - 18 Ball Bag
product_meta.description: Color:Original VersionThe Wilson Pressure less Tennis Balls are great for tennis practice sessions. The superior quality of the rubber shell ensures that these balls do not lose their bounce over time. They work well for practices with ball machines because they easily stand up to heavy usage. The tennis training balls come in a reusable mesh bag with 18 balls per package.
feature_bullets: 18 Pressure less practice tennis balls in a mesh bag
Long lasting Pressure less tennis balls

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars290 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
